sen.j: 柳は1924年（大正13年）1月に山梨県池田村（現在の甲府市郊外）村長で郷土史研究者の小宮山清三の自宅を訪れ、小宮山家所蔵の朝鮮陶磁の調査をしていた。
sen.e: Yanagi visited the home of the mayor of Ikeda Village (today's an outskirt of Kofu City), Yamanashi Prefecture and local history researcher, Seizo KOMIYAMA in January 1924 to research Korean ceramic ware of Komiyama family.

sen.j: 柳は小宮山から地蔵菩薩像を贈られるとそれから半年の間に懸案であった朝鮮民族美術館の開館などを済ませると、小宮山らの協力を得て木喰仏の調査研究のため木喰の故郷である丸畑をはじめ日本各地を奔走することになる。
sen.e: Although Yanagi was given the Jizo Bosatsu-zo statue by Komiyama, he was obliged to leave if for half a year as he had to finish the pending Korean Folklore Art Museum, and after he opened the museum, he started researches on mokujiki-butsu and busily engaged in visiting many places in the country such as Mokujiki's birthplace, Maruhata with the cooperation of Komiyama.

sen.j: 同年だけで300体以上の木喰仏を発見し、木喰仏の墨書銘や、納経帳や宿帳など自筆文書の発見により断片的な木喰の足跡が解明され、小宮山や山梨日日新聞社長の野口二郎らと雑誌『木喰上人之研究』を発刊する。
sen.e: Yanagi found more than 300 pieces of mokujiki-butsu only within the year, discovered fragmentary tracks of Mokujiki with inscriptions of the statues, records of leaving copy of sutra and autography, and he published "Researches on Mokujiki-shonin" with Komiyama and the president of The Yamanashi Nichinichi Shimbun newspaper, Jiro NOGUCHI.
